alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 25 at 4:55PM CDT until June 26 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR CALHOUN...CLEBURNE AND SOUTHEASTERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES... At 455 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Pleasant Gap to near Piedmont to near Ohatchee, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Anniston, Oxford, Jacksonville, Piedmont, Heflin, Fort McClellan, Saks, Glencoe, Weaver, Ranburne, Fruithurst, Edwardsville, Pleasant Gap, Blue Mountain, Alexandria, Jacksonville State University, Muscadine, Abernathy, Mars Hills and Southside. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
